an5.68:1.1: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still not awake but intent on awakening—I developed and cultivated five things.
an5.68:1.3: The basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort …
an5.68:1.4: the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy, and active effort …
an5.68:1.5: the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to mental development, and active effort …
an5.68:1.6: the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry, and active effort.
an5.68:1.7: And the fifth is sheer vigor.
an5.68:1.8: When I had developed and cultivated these five things, with vigor as fifth,
an5.68:1.9: I became capable of realizing anything that can be realized by insight to which I extended the mind, in each and every case.
an5.68:2.1: If I wished: ‘May I multiply myself and become one again … controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm.’
an5.68:2.2: I was capable of realizing it, in each and every case.
an5.68:3.1: If I wished: … ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’
an5.68:3.2: I was capable of realizing it, in each and every case.”
